ext_weather.name: Tonight
ext_weather.detailedForecast: A chance of rain between 7pm and 10pm, then widespread fog and a slight chance of rain between 10pm and 11pm. Cloudy, with a low around 37. South wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

space_weather:
Space Weather Message Code: WATA20
Serial Number: 1086
Issue Time: 2026 Jan 06 2218 UTC

WATCH: Geomagnetic Storm Category G1 Predicted

Highest Storm Level Predicted by Day:
Jan 07:  None (Below G1)   Jan 08:  None (Below G1)   Jan 09:  G1 (Minor)

THIS SUPERSEDES ANY/ALL PRIOR WATCHES IN EFFECT

NOAA Space Weather Scale descriptions can be found at
www.swpc.noaa.gov/noaa-scales-explanation

Potential Impacts: Area of impact primarily poleward of 60 degrees Geomagnetic Latitude.
Induced Currents - Weak power grid fluctuations can occur.
Spacecraft - Minor impact on satellite operations possible.
Aurora - Aurora may be visible at high latitudes, i.e., northern tier of the U.S. such as northern Michigan and Maine.
